result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew M Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Heroin), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. (Defendant is serving a prison sentence)  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive for failure to pay all costs fees assessments and surcharges by 5/7/15.

Credit for 14 days time served.
Concurrent with: with sentence already serving

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew M Payne

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew M Payne in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Defendant Andrew M Payne in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONCURRENT to sentence ALREADY SERVING with credit for 14 days time served.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and to pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. (Defendant is serving a prison sentence)  Cash bail to apply.  Defendant to serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive for failure to pay all costs fees assessments and surcharges by 5/7/2015.  

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney William J Reddin in court, defendant Andrew M Payne not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  NO spins available.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 5/7/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney William J Reddin in court, defendant Andrew M Payne not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  No offer has been given, and defense requests a plea date.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/23/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Case is set for Scheduling Conference on February 21, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. in Branch 03.

Defendant Andrew M Payne in court with attorney William J Reddin.  Defendant Andrew M Payne in custody.  Paul Hauer for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Fiorenza, Br. 03.

14RM004519  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/4/14 vf
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for ENHANCED SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Andrew M Payne in court with attorney Matthew Lamke.  Defendant Andrew M Payne in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
